meanings.definition: One of the homologous body segments that compose the body of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The metameres of the worm help in its movement.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the metameres of different animals to understand their anatomy.
meanings.sent3: The metameres of the snake decided to have a race.
meanings.sent4: Each metamere of the caterpillar represents a stage of its growth.
meanings.sent5: Counting the metameres of the fish made the biology lesson more interesting.

meanings.definition: A segmental structure or division in an organism.
meanings.sent1: The metameres of the insect show its complex internal organization.
meanings.sent2: The metameres of the earthworm allow it to move efficiently through the soil.
meanings.sent3: The metameres of the tree had a meeting to discuss their growth plans.
meanings.sent4: Each metamere of the centipede seemed to have a personality of its own.
meanings.sent5: The metameres of the flower were beautifully arranged in a spiral pattern.
